Advocate for systemic / institutional change if you are in a position to do so, but also, do the stuff that you immediately can.
#disruptJMM #JMM2020 user10

Donating your time or money to LGBTQ+ people or causes is a good way to apologize meaningfully.
#disruptJMM #JMM2020 user10

Waiting for shitty people to retire and/or die doesn't solve any problems for anyone. They're making new transphobes all the time.
#disruptJMM #JMM2020 user10

But like, own your responsibility to do better, and don't put the labor on trans / nb people to tell you how to do better.
#disruptJMM #JMM2020 user10

How can allies best handle making mistakes? Know that you're human and give yourself grace. But also, guilt is a useful motivator to do better. Use negative experiences to change yourself for the better. Don't make the same mistake again and again.
#disruptJMM #JMM2020 user10

Resources we should learn about: Trevor Project, OSTEM, PFLAG ...
#disruptJMM #JMM2020 user10

There are trans and non-binary students, staff, and faculty across campus. If your solidarity doesn't extend outside of your own classroom, it's not going far enough. 
#disruptJMM #JMM2020 user10
In every class, there is a culture. If you're not being intentional about what you want the culture to be, then you can end up with something you really don't want. #DisruptJMM #JMM2020 user10

.user157 suggests that taking a different approach to mathematical epistemology, and thus broadening your perception of what counts as "mathematical" participation, helps #DisruptJMM that hegemony. #JMM2020 user10

Mathematics is currently the province of a particular cultural group. Therefore, it not only *reflects* the hegemony of that group, but *reinforces* the hegemony of that group. No points for guessing which group. #DisruptJMM #JMM2020 user10 https://t.co/VVDsVuI3OJ
Figured out user157 s Twitter handle, belatedly. This feels like a really important theoretical contribution. #DisruptJMM #JMM2020 user10 https://t.co/pGgr8j6fUT

A feminist epistemology of mathematics challenges the absolutism that characterizes how we think about truth in mathematics. This is really important because we have spent way not enough time examining our epistemological foundations. #DisruptJMM #JMM2020 user10

For my new followers:

I developed a class last summer called Fractals, Algorithms, and Us. I wanted to build an inclusive class where STEM students could learn math while having space to talk/journal about power/justice. #JMM2020 and #DisruptJMM have shown me I‚Äôm not alone üíú
